intro: Ryania speciosa var. chocoensis, commonly known as the Chocó ryania, is a tropical tree native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, red-orange flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain numerous elliptical seeds. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
